description:
This is a world where heroes are created by people's trust, and the hero who gains the most trust is known as X. In this world, people's trust can be quantified through data, and these values are reflected on everyone's wrist. As long as one gains enough trust points, an ordinary person can possess superpowers and become a superhero who saves the world. However, the constantly changing trust values make the path of a hero full of uncertainties...

(Source: Official To Be Hero X home page)

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

alternative: Yuwei Liu (リウ・ユーウェイ)
Zhong Yaojin (チョン・ヤオジン)
King Destruction (キング・デストラクション)

[Weibo](https://weibo.com/u/2421419590) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzehua1)
[Weibo](https://weibo.com/u/2421419590) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzehua1)
__[Twitter](https://x.com/haolin24870943)__ | __[Weibo](https://weibo.com/u/1816375314)__

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

[Profile (bransic)](https://bransic.net/composer_musician/misaki-umase) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/UmaseMisaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/umasemisaki/) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@umasemisaki) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5ZorNjW9rIlOHlhmIIZ2tQ) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/misaki-umase/1455312345) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/61028472)

__[Website](https://kenmochihidefumi.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/h_kenmochi)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgbOZQizidkPhcjnJUOZb8Q/featured)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7v28R5tD4j8lvl6ok2N8Qg)__

__Birthplace:__ Shinagawa City, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Kenmochi Hidefumi is a Japanese musician, producer, DJ, composer and member of the band [Wednesday Campanella](https://anilist.co/staff/286888), who works under record labels UNPRIVATE ACOUSTICS, Hydeout Productions and KUJAKU CLUB. He began his career in the jazz rap scene, where he got in contact with Nujabes. He released an album titled "Falliccia" in 2008 through his label Hydeout Productions.
__Profile (Verygoo)__ | __Twitter__ __Shuuhei Mutsuki__ is a Japanese composer and orchestrator. He is also a music creator for the creative music unit (K)NoW_NAME.

[Website](https://hideyukifukasawa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eicheph) | [Blog](https://eicheph.blogspot.com/)

Hideyuki Fukasawa is a Japanese composer. He has often worked with [Capcom](https://anilist.co/staff/109955/Capcom) but is also involved in his freelance composing work. He had a minor role in Onimusha 2 as an assistant sound engineer and programmer to [Taro Iwashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/100948/Tarou-Iwashiro), the acclaimed music composer of that particular game but it was his work on Chaos Legion, a Capcom Gothic action-adventure third-person fighting game in a similar fashion with the Devil May Cry series released in 2002, that gave him a cult-like status among video gaming fans. In 2008 he composed and arranged the music for Street Fighter IV, Marvel vs Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds, and the updated versions of both said games, with some tracks arranged from previous games.

He was the main composer for [TYPE-MOON's](https://anilist.co/staff/97582/TypeMoon) remake of the visual novel Tsukihime. 

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Chaos Legion (Video Game, 2003) (Composer)
- Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams (Video Game, 2006) (Composer)
- Street Fighter IV (Video Game, 2008) (Composer)
- Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds (Video Game, 2011) (Composer)
- Street Fighter X Tekken (Video Game, 2012) (Composer)
- Witch on the Holy Night (Visual Novel, 2012) (Composer)
- Street Fighter V (Video Game, 2016) (Composer)
- TSUKIHIME -A piece of blue glass moon- (Visual Novel, 2021) (Composer) !~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kohta_yamabook) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamabook_kohta/) | [Website](https://www.kohtayamamoto.net/)

Formerly affiliated with Legendoor, he is now in business partnership with VV-ALKLINE.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147)

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147)
